author: SchoolTube Community
title: The Fascinating World of Sharks: Separating Fact from Fiction | SchoolTube
text: The Fascinating World of Sharks: Separating Fact from Fiction Sharks are among the most captivating and misunderstood creatures on Earth. Their sleek bodies, powerful jaws, and ancient lineage have inspired awe, fear, and countless myths throughout history. With the rise of popular culture, sharks have become a recurring theme in movies, television shows, and even video games, often portrayed as ferocious predators that pose a constant threat to humans. But how much of this portrayal is based on reality? This article delves into the fascinating world of sharks, separating fact from fiction. Weâ€™ll explore their diverse biology, their essential role in marine ecosystems, and the reasons behind their often-negative portrayal in the media. By understanding these magnificent creatures, we can appreciate their true nature and dispel the misconceptions that surround them. Myth: Sharks are Man-Eating Machines One of the most persistent myths about sharks is that they are indiscriminate man-eaters. While itâ€™s true that some shark species can pose a threat to humans, the vast majority are not interested in us as prey. In fact, there are over 500 species of sharks, and only a handful have been known to attack humans, and even fewer are considered to be truly dangerous. The most common shark attacks involve species like the great white, tiger, and bull shark, all of which inhabit coastal waters frequented by humans. However, even these species are more likely to be wary of humans than aggressive towards them. Most attacks are believed to be cases of mistaken identity, where the shark mistakes a human for its usual prey, such as seals or sea lions. Myth: Sharks Attack Humans Without Provocation Another common myth is that sharks attack humans without any provocation. While some attacks may seem unprovoked, the reality is that sharks are usually triggered by a variety of factors, including: - Sight: Sharks have excellent vision and can spot potential prey from a distance. - Smell: Sharks have a highly developed sense of smell and can detect traces of blood, urine, or other bodily fluids in the water. - Sound: Sharks are sensitive to sound and vibrations in the water, which can be caused by splashing, swimming, or even the sound of a boat engine. - Movement: Sharks are attracted to movement in the water, which can be interpreted as a sign of potential prey. By understanding these triggers, we can take steps to minimize our risk of encountering a shark in the first place. This includes avoiding swimming in areas known to have a high shark population, avoiding swimming at dawn or dusk when sharks are most active, and being mindful of our movements in the water. Myth: Sharks are Unintelligent Creatures Sharks are often portrayed as mindless, instinct-driven creatures, but this couldnâ€™t be further from the truth. Research has shown that sharks are highly intelligent animals, capable of complex behaviors and problem-solving. They have excellent memory, can learn from experience, and even exhibit social interactions. For example, studies have shown that sharks can recognize individual humans, and even associate certain people with positive or negative experiences. They also have a sophisticated communication system, using a variety of sounds and movements to communicate with each other. The Importance of Sharks Sharks play a vital role in maintaining the health of our oceans. As apex predators, they help to control populations of other marine animals, keeping ecosystems in balance. They also contribute to the health of coral reefs, which are essential for marine biodiversity and coastal protection. Sadly, shark populations are declining worldwide due to overfishing, habitat loss, and bycatch. Itâ€™s crucial that we take steps to protect these amazing creatures and ensure their survival for future generations. Conclusion: Embracing the Truth About Sharks By understanding the truth about sharks, we can dispel the myths and misconceptions that surround them. These magnificent creatures are not mindless man-eating machines, but rather intelligent, complex, and essential parts of our planetâ€™s ecosystem. By appreciating their true nature, we can become better stewards of the oceans and ensure their continued existence for generations to come.

author: Chris Jackson
title: Ruidoso firefighters jumped into action to save lives during flooding
text:
Ruidoso firefighters jumped into action to save lives during flooding
RUIDOSO, N.M. â€” The orange Xâ€™s bring a little relief.
â€œJust kind of moved stuff around, make sure thereâ€™s nobody that was hidden or scared at the time,â€ said Captain Justin Mize of the Ruidoso Fire Department.
That â€˜Xâ€™ means nobody was left behind in the now destroyed Gavilan Mobile Home Park.
â€œI think our emergency process helped save a bunch of lives with this flood coming through,â€ Mize said.
Mize is one of the nine volunteers who jump into flood waters to save people in peril.
â€œThe longer the week goes the more emotions kick in after what you see,â€ he said. â€œSo itâ€™s been â€¦ itâ€™s been tough.â€
We asked what it looked like for Mize personally.
â€œWoo, well itâ€™s chaotic,â€ he replied. â€œItâ€™s really chaotic, you know? You gotta â€¦ thereâ€™s times when youâ€™re not sure if youâ€™re going to make it (out) when you get in.â€
Mize and another firefighter braved the swirling water when the calls for help went out.
â€œWe got seven out,â€ he said. â€œYeah, two kids and the rest (were) adults. The kids were 7 and nine.
â€œThey were actually inside of a home and the water had gotten so high that it was pushing them up to the roof. They were touching the roof with their hands. Yeah, they were swimming. Yeah, inside the house.â€
He swam inside a home as the water ripped it apart.
â€œKnocked out walls, blew out windows, so they were just sitting there, screaming for help,â€ Mize said. â€œSo luckily we got to them before they got swept away.â€

author: Team MP
title: Will protect Myanmar border like that of Bangladesh: Shah
text: Will protect Myanmar border like that of Bangladesh: Shah GUWAHATI/TEZPUR: Home Minister Amit Shah on Saturday said the government will stop the free movement of people at the Myanmar border and will protect it like that of Bangladesh. Addressing the passing out parade of the first batch of the five newly-constituted Assam Police Commando battalions, he said the Centre is rethinking the free-movement facility with Myanmar. â€œThe India-Myanmar border will be protected like the Bangladesh border... The Government of India will stop the free movement with Myanmar,â€ he said. Shah said there has been a huge change in the law and order of the country under the leadership of PM Narendra Modi during the last 10 years. Attacking the Congress, he alleged that people had to pay bribes to get government jobs during its tenure, and maintained that not a single penny has to be paid for employment under the BJP rule. On the consecration ceremony in Ayodhya, Shah said that Lord Ram would return home after 550 â€œdisrespectfulâ€ years. â€œItâ€™s a matter of pride for entire India,â€ he said, noting that it was happening at a time when the country was on course to become a superpower. Amit Shah said Prime Minister Narendra Modiâ€™s mission of bringing peace and development in the northeast has been successful. The Congress had a policy to â€œdivert attention from problems and enjoy power, which led to the deaths of thousands of people in the regionâ€, particularly in the Bodoland, Shah said at the 13th Triennial Conference of the All Bathou Mahasabha in Dhekiajuli, Assam on Saturday. The Prime Minister also viewed it from a new perspective and the problem was resolved with Bodoland â€œtoday being free from bomb blasts, firing and violenceâ€, Shah said. During the last three years, there has been no incident of violence in Bodoland, and it is scripting a new story by walking on the path of development, Shah asserted. Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Saturday asserted that the country will be free from the menace of Naxalism in the next three years. Shah, while addressing the Sashastra Seema Balâ€™s 60th Raising Day at Salonibari in Tezpur, also said among all the Central armed police forces, SSB plays â€œa unique role in minutely integrating culture, history, topography and languageâ€ of the border villages, and bringing people in those areas closer to rest of the country. The home minister presented awards for exemplary service to six SSB personnel along with trophies to three battalions, besides releasing a postage stamp on the occasion. Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma was present at the event, too.

author: @mdjonline
title: Metro Atlanta posts strong job growth in November
text:
From the Henssler Financial Studio this is your news minute on the Marietta Daily Journal Podcast presented by Engineered Solutions of Georgia. Today is Monday, January 1st, and I'm
Keith Ippolito.
Metro Atlanta posts strong job growth in November
In a notable development, the jobless rate in metro Atlanta dipped to 4.2% in November, compared to 4.3% the previous month. The data, provided by the State Department of Labor, indicates a solid job market, especially in the retail and hospitality sectors, reflecting a boost in shopping, dining, and entertainment activities.
This year, Atlanta's economic resilience has been conspicuous, attracting talent from across the state and contributing to the majority of new jobs in Georgia. The growth in the job market exceeded expectations, contradicting earlier predictions of an economic downturn. However, certain companies, including FAB Precision Sheetmetal and Truist Bank, have announced layoffs and branch closures, underscoring challenges within specific sectors.
Despite these variations, Atlanta's job base grew by 2.47% over the past year, outpacing both the state and national growth rates. With an unemployment rate of 4.2%, the city continues to demonstrate its economic vitality.
For more news about our community, visit
mdjonline.com. For the Marrietta Daily Journal Podcast, I'm Keith Ippolito. www.esogrepair.com www.henssler.com www.bgpodcastnetwork.com

author: @francophileenoz
title: Queensland Women Drown in Gympie Stormwater Drain | Illawarra Mercury | Wollongong, NSW
text: Two Queensland women who drowned in a stormwater drain following wild weather conditions have been identified as 46-year-old Tanya Hehir and 40-year-old Helen Bradford. The women were exploring a 2.4km drain called the "love tunnel" in Gympie with a friend when they were swept away by floodwaters. Their companion, a 46-year-old woman made it to safety and contacted police. Emergency services were called to the Kidd Bridge around 3.20pm. A search and rescue operation commenced involving water police, general duties officers, swift water rescue crews and the SES. Police first recovered Helen Bradford's body at 7:10pm on Boxing Day and Tanya Hehir's body on December 27. Tanya Hehir was a keen runner and a member of the Gympie Hash House Harriers. Gympie Regional Council mayor Glen Hartwig told the ABC that he would consider new safety measures in light of the tragedy. "It's an old stormwater system that's been there since the foundation of Gympie," he said. "It's not a place to be played with. It's not a place where you want to go and explore." Acting superintendent Paul Algie said in recent times that weather events were developing quickly and advised the public to be careful near water. "There is always the chance tragedy can strike," he said. Sign up for our newsletter to stay up to date. We care about the protection of your data. Read our [Privacy Policy](/privacy/).

author: Lilybeth Valles
title: Ruidoso wildfire victims getting help from local businesses | newswest9.com
text:
ODESSA, Texas â€” A handful of local and small businesses in the Permian Basin have formed a coalition to garner as many donations for victims of the Ruidoso wildfires .
Upon viewing the images of the destructive wildfires, Derrick Black started making calls to get as many businesses involved.
"Watching these trees, these animals and these family's homes turn into ashes really hit home," said Black, a member of the nonprofit organization called Oilfield Connections International , and a part of Farm Energy Technologies.
Here's a list of local businesses who are keeping their doors open and welcoming donations.
ðŸ“Donation Drop-Off Locations:
American Safety Services, Inc. on 13416 E IH-20 Odessa, TX. 79765 TLR Welding & Fabricating, Inc - TLR Hose & Supply on 7300 W I-20 frontage Midland, TX. 79706 TXAM Pumps on 2381 E I-20 Odessa, TX. 79766 JA Oilfield Manufacturing and Services, Inc. 14579 HollyHock Ave. Gardendale, TX. 79758 Cameron, a Schlumberger company on 4580 W. Wall St. Midland, TX. 79703 Southern Tire Mart on 12618 E I-20 Odessa, TX 79765 PERSEVERANCE SERVICES LLC is providing the transportation needed to make these deliveries possible "Right now our biggest concentration is to help the firefighters out there, so things like non- perishable foods, snacks, waters," Black said. "One of the residents who actually reached out to me directly and what they're mentioning is they need twin size sheets because a lot of the displaced families are having to sleep on cots and they don't have sheets to cover these beds."
Black said other requests may include dry foods for pets.
TXAM Pumps will be serving as the main hub for donations, keeping its doors open through the weekend.
"That's the spirit that we have as Americans," said Johnny Garcia with TXAM Pumps. "This is our land we need to protect it. We need to take care of it. And when a catastrophe like this happens, we rise up."
This round of donations will be accepted through Monday of the following week. According to Black, they'll continue the efforts for as long as it's needed.
Related Articles Wildfires in Ruidoso in real time West Texans come together to help Ruidoso wildfire victims Gov. Greg Abbott to deploy Texas emergency management resources to Ruidoso to fight wildfires Close Ad

TambÃ© destaca pels Joy-Con redissenyats, amb un ajust ergonÃ²mic mÃ©s precÃ­s que permet mÃ©s comoditat i estabilitat en partides llargues. A mÃ©s, el sistema dâ€™Ã udio, ara ajustable i optimitzat, millora notablement la qualitat del so, especialment quan es juga sense auriculars.

Aquesta nova versiÃ³ Ã©s ideal per a persones que busquen jugar de manera flexible: a casa, al transport pÃºblic, en viatges o en reunions amb amics. La pantalla tÃ ctil mÃ©s gran permet gaudir millor dels detalls visuals i fa que jocs com Mario Kart o Zelda es vegin encara mÃ©s vius.

Aquesta mena de promocions solen tenir una durada limitada i normalment sâ€™exhaureixen rÃ pidament, ja sigui per disponibilitat o per finalitzaciÃ³ de campanyes. Si fa temps que mires una consola aixÃ­ o vols fer un bon regal, ara Ã©s un bon moment per considerar-ho amb calma.
A mÃ©s, amb Mario Kart World inclÃ²s de sÃ¨rie, el paquet resulta encara mÃ©s rodÃ³. Ã‰s un dâ€™aquells productes que realment et fan el dia a dia mÃ©s fÃ cil, ja que combina entreteniment, tecnologia i versatilitat en un sol dispositiu.
